00040 #ifndef __CVMX_SHMEM_H__
00041 #define __CVMX_SHMEM_H__
00042 
00043 /**
00044  * @file
00045  *
00046  * cvmx-shmem provides APIs for setting up shared memory between Linux
00047  * and simple executive applications.
00048  *
00049  * <hr>$Revision: 41586 $<hr>
00050  */
00051 
00052 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00053 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00054 extern "C" {
00055 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 #include "cvmx-spinlock.h"
00059 
00060 #define CVMX_SHMEM_NUM_DSCPTR       8
00061 #define CVMX_SHMEM_DSCPTR_NAME         "SMDR"
00062 
00063 #define CVMX_SHMEM_O_RDONLY         0x00
00064 #define CVMX_SHMEM_O_WRONLY         0x01
00065 #define CVMX_SHMEM_O_RDWR           0x02
00066 #define CVMX_SHMEM_O_CREAT          0x04
00067 
00068 #define CVMX_SHMEM_MAP_PROT_READ    0x01
00069 #define CVMX_SHMEM_MAP_PROT_WRITE   0x02
00070 #define CVMX_SHMEM_MAP_EXEC         0x04
00071 
00072 #define CVMX_SHMEM_OWNER_NONE       0xff
00073 
00074 #define CVMX_SHMEM_VADDR64_START    0x500000000ULL
00075 #define CVMX_SHMEM_VADDR64_END      0x600000000ULL
00076 
00077 #define CVMX_SHMEM_VADDR32_START    0x10000000
00078 #define CVMX_SHMEM_VADDR32_END      0x18000000
00079 
00080 struct cvmx_shmem_dscptr {
00081     cvmx_spinlock_t lock;
00082     uint64_t owner:8;
00083     uint64_t is_named_block:1;
00084     uint64_t p_wronly:1;
00085     uint64_t p_rdwr:1;
00086     int32_t use_count;  /* must use atomic operation to maintain count */
00087     const char *name;
00088     void *vaddr;
00089     uint64_t paddr;
00090     uint32_t size;
00091     uint64_t alignment;
00092 };
00093 
00094 struct cvmx_shmem_smdr {
00095     cvmx_spinlock_t lock;
00096     struct cvmx_shmem_dscptr shmd[CVMX_SHMEM_NUM_DSCPTR];
00097     void *break64;      /* Keep track of unused 64 bit virtual address space */
00098 };
00099 
00100 struct cvmx_shmem_smdr *cvmx_shmem_init(void);
00101 
00102 /**
00103  *  Create a piece memory out of named block
00104  *
00105  *  @param name Named block name
00106  *  @param size block size in bytes
00107  *  @param oflag create flag
00108  *  @return descriptor for named block
00109  */
00110 struct cvmx_shmem_dscptr *cvmx_shmem_named_block_open(char *name, uint32_t size, int oflag);
00111 
00112 /**
00113  *  Update TLB mapping based on the descriptor
00114  */
00115 void *cvmx_shmem_map(struct cvmx_shmem_dscptr *desc, int pflag);
00116 
00117 /**
00118  *  Remove the TLB mapping created for the descriptor
00119  */
00120 void cvmx_shmem_unmap(struct cvmx_shmem_dscptr *desc);
00121 
00122 /**
00123  *  Close the share memory,
00124  *
00125  *  @param remove  Remove the named block if it is created by the application
00126  */
00127 int cvmx_shmem_close(struct cvmx_shmem_dscptr *desc, int remove);
00128 
00129 /**
00130  * Debug function, dump all SMDR descriptors
00131  */
00132 void cvmx_shmem_show(void);
00133 
00134 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00135 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00136 }
00137 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00138 #endif
00139 #endif
